Articles.Content:
The premise is simple. Pretend you are in the future, and talk about events that occurred in the future. To prevent a flame war, we will all happily assume that NASA doesn't get its SLS cancelled and Orion is fully funded throughout its development and China builds its spacestation and goes to the moon while NASA gets its wish of going to Mars and stuff happens and we aren't a nuclear wasteland yet. Yet.

[End Description]

That SLS launch today was spectacular! The rocket made it off the pad safely, and the sound quality of the live stream was pretty fantastic. I hope the crew gets to the asteroid safely and all that. We should really fund NASA more, these SLS rockets are pretty awesome. A lot of people are saying NASA is back in its Apollo days, and I sure hope it is.
Well, it's nice that we finally got back to the moon after 59 years! But this achievement was done by..... China. Really? Come on NASA! Get your act together!
Well, at least they finally got that funding boost a few years ago.
Has anyone played Kingdom Hearts 3 yet? I hear it's awesome, but it's only on Xbox One and PlayStation 4...
What? I thought it was on Xbox Five and Playstation 9!

The Europa probe finnaly got to Europa! It said there were living creatures there, they looked AWESOME! Did you guys see it on TV?

Also, KSP 2.4.3 was released! It added alot of stuff, but because i don't want to spoil it, i'll let you guys see it for yourselves
KSP 2- Rise of the Kraken is an amazing addition to the series! I especially like the addition of resource mining! and it's only been 30 years!

I am so excited that the case against Apple under the Amazon Act finally goes to court!

Hopefully users will get to decide which software they want to use on their devices at last.
Spaceworkers dispute in London today. A lightning strike by orbital shuttle officers led to over 2,000 passengers being held up for up to 10 hours to board flights.
An unknown so far Jules Vernes manuscript just been discovered and released to the public. This is a true amazing story and it broke all sales records.
Guys! I just noticed something about my warp to Andromeda! The shuttle was called "Lambda" and the warp took almost exactly 3 hours! Half-Life 3 confirmed!!
[date=2062.9.12]Oh man, I really hope the manned mission to negotiate with the creatures of Achird B d goes well...
Well, it's 3333, and Valve FINALLY released HL3! It's only been, what, like, 3000 years!

Welcome to the Year 1,000,000,000,000. Goodbye.

*you get killed by a invincible dinosaur cyborg made of pure energy*

Edited August 30, 2014 by Souper

I nerly got sidswipd by a hovrbike omy wy to the Lunr Elevatr this morn. I swer, pepl ar getin crazer by the minit. I cant imagin what it was lik hundrds of yers ago when pepl wer only drivin in two dimensions. That must hav ben hec to del with. Rely, tho, it sed on the news yesterdy that an elevatr repar dron smacd into a polic hovrcraft. We'r givin them rot aces to our brans now - I fel lik it's one smal step from her to the robot uprisin.

I men, what ar thos poor pepl on Betlgeuse 5 gon to do if a constructr malfunctions? Shot at it with laser tols?
People names are replaced by there IP by commodity.
